Add mocha and test to ensure that a post with a branch name really

Add a test to ensure calling a build by branchname works.

this matches rip and uses at least 1.4.0 to match new Tinder API:

https://github.com/defunkt/cijoe/commit/6d4823c
Signed-off-by: Josh Owens <joshua.owens@gmail.com>
Oops, need to pass the build to campfire when we notify.  Just did a production test.
Updated README to use campfire tokens.
Move Campfire to be it's own class, no need to do wonky class level methods, it causes issues with multiple joes.
Add a test helper to setup and teardown tmp git repos easily.
Add more to the json output, so we can keep general-hawk up to date.
Add json as a runtime dependency.

Add in proper JSON support with matching test for post handling

- Add test/fixtures/payload.json from actual github payload
- Add a test for post "/?" method
- Remove the payload.empty? build logic from the post method,
  as it causes everything to run when it gets a post
Fixed the munging of the env problem that was causing some builds to fail.
campfire needs to know the branch
attempt #2 to consume github json with yaml

Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/cmw/cijoe into cmw-master

Conflicts:

Copy the build status back to @current_build.

* @current_build needs to hold the SHA hashes and the
  commit URL for the notifiers.
Stop Choice.rest from returning an Array in 1.9. Fixes #28
Empty the ENV before building. Closes #31
Add a rack_start method that takes a project_path argument, allowing multiple joes inside rack.
cijoe version in the sinatra interface. closes #22
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/gotascii/cijoe into gotascii-master

Smarter smarts for determining whether we should build after a POST

version bump for 'gem build' to work

Now with consistent URI for API
Tests pass, time to test for real
changes from upstream that aren't merged into master...meh

POST /?branch=coupons to run on branch "coupons" instead of default
don't warn about campfire configuration in test environment
include the build duration in campfire notification

restore loads last/current build unconditionally

Otherwise, cijoe doesn't work properly when run under multiple
processes. P1 will never load changes made by P2 once the initial
settings are loaded.
Fixing the campfire integration to work with the new non-global project_path.
GET /ping should return 'building' in the response body when a build is running, even if there is a previous build
Don't pretend to have a pid - this prevents tests from acting up in case you happen to have a process running with pid 1337
Update tests with interface changes from d16b3ea244c1abd4d3e7
limit OUTPUT env var to 100k to prevent E2BIG errors
clean out env variables after invoking hooks
deal with external build failures where last_build.commit is nil
Added Signal to the bad boys :)
Use the Commit class to generate commit URLs
Examples scripts for notifications via email (git hooks)

Fixed tests broken by ec1677a

 * project_path initialization in Config
   take global (cmdline) or use self as default

Wider layout for wide monitors (40em -> 80%)

 Cherry picked from Rob's Sanheim master:

   We have big monitors - lets use a little more space for the output

cherry-picked: Fix a very annoying bug that was breaking HTTP basic auth...

  - The load order was such that the config class was being loaded
    before the project_path was being chdir'ed to.  This meant the first
    time the http auth user/pass was being retrieved (via `git config`)
    it was being done in the current dir, instead of the project dir --
    and the current dir was often not a git repo.

    So that meant that the http user/pass was empty strings the first
    time, which was the only time the server would check it - so http auth
    was effectively never working.  At least for me.

    Not sure how this worked for anyone before -- maybe everyone who has used
    http auth starts cijoe from within the repo dir?

    Anyways, this is a fairly ugly hack to ensure that the git commands in Config
    are always run in the context of the project path.
Add duration to Build, show on finished builds
Make ivar vs. accessor consistent in CIJoe::Server.
Add a /ping resource and a few CIJoe::Server tests.
Wait for the runner to exit before grabbing status

adding some tests to check for a valid git config values.
 This fixes a bug with earlier versions of git which do not
 have a config command. With older versions, cijoe would start
 up in auth mode and take gits error message as username
 and password.
A favicon helps identify the tab in some browsers.
we don't need the diff, thanks

fix issues parsing raw commit info when a commit is a merge

There's an additional "Merge: SHA1 SHA2" header line so we can't
assume the line positions mean anything.

write current build immediately after obtaining SHA

Prevents issues with the last_build not having a SHA when
something fails before the command is executed.
fix after-reset not being run when last_commit not established
track pid with build so we can detect stale build files
only one cijoe server thread executes at a time
persist build info to disk - allows > 1 backends

adding some tests to check for a valid git config values.
 This fixes a bug with earlier versions of git which do not
 have a config command. With older versions, cijoe would start
 up in auth mode and take gits error message as username
 and password.

- Runner uses IO.popen instead of open4. I could not get
open4 to run a rake task. It blocked forever

They are ANSI colour codes, not bash.

Talk about Dean Strelau's improvements in the README.

If the payload is empty or specifies our branch, build.

If it's not empty and doesn't specify our branch, it's probably a post-receive hook telling us about something we're not interested in.
Only build if we see the branch name we care about in the post-receive POST
